content:
Interesting and well-written problem!

I'd consider that sort of complexity for the input format more appropriate for 10-min clashes.

The inputs lack a final newline, this can make it more painful to read the last line properly in multiple languages.
(Seriously, are you CG staff? Absence of a final newline should at the very least be a big red warning in the new clash proposal UI)
The final newline character is automatically added during our pre-valid process, plus we have a tool to check that inputs of a clash can be read correctly ;)
I beg to differ. Would you need an example of a clash where a final newline is *not* present?
Yes, definitely. Just an idea of what the clash is about and I'll look into it.

First clash I tried this morning: alcane identification (methane, propane...) No final newline in any of the test cases.
(this is one of those that's not too disturbing, but it says something I got one on first try)
Edit: second clash I tried this morning: number of bits to encode a number.

PS: your reply below is the fastest answer I've ever seen here.
I'll investigate the issue the issue this morning.
